aboutme.title: Who am I?
aboutme.text: Hello! I am a passionate full stack developer with experience in multiplatform applications and microcomputer and network systems. I have worked with cutting-edge technologies such as TypeScript (Angular, Node.js), JavaScript, ASP.NET, PHP, .NET Framework, and C#, developing web, desktop, and API applications that integrate systems efficiently. My experience includes SQL Server database design and management, application optimization, and complex problem-solving, always aiming for robust and scalable solutions. I have participated in projects that improve internal processes, increase efficiency, and facilitate system integration. Throughout my career, I have developed not only strong technical skills but also an analytical mindset and a problem-solving focus. I am constantly seeking new challenges and opportunities to add value to innovative projects. I am ready to collaborate on your next project and take it to the next level!
aboutme.introExperiencias: I have accumulated valuable experience as a programmer, starting with a multidisciplinary approach that has allowed me not only to master technical skills but also to develop an analytical mindset and an ability to solve problems efficiently.

netframework.name: .NET Framework
experiences: I designed and developed a distributed ecosystem in .NET for physical access control management, with multiple servers and programs connected to each other and to mobile/desktop applications. The system integrated multi-factor authentication (NFC, QR, fingerprint, facial recognition), centralized user and permission management, and real-time synchronization with hardware devices.

The main server acted as the communication core, managing menus and asynchronous calls, and sending/receiving encrypted packets with XOR or AES. Secondary servers extended specific functionalities, and a distribution server handled sending data and photos to selected devices. All communication was carried out through structured binary packets (protocol type, origin, encryption type), with CRC16/CRC32 to ensure integrity.

The main desktop application allowed the registration of employees, visitors, and contractors, as well as the management of facilities, floors, departments, and access permissions. Depending on the configuration, information was automatically propagated to connected devices via sockets or manually from the application.

An API server exposed endpoints (Service.cs, Program.cs, Startup.cs) for consumption by Angular, Ionic, and Android Studio applications, using SignalR for real-time synchronization. Facial recognition was implemented with OpenCV and other third-party libraries, and offline messaging was managed through a proprietary MQTT broker, capable of sending encrypted notifications to applications without relying on Firebase.
